snippet: Minimum wage increases go into effect in 20 states and the District of Columbia by Jan. 1, and, all told, 29 states will exceed the federal minimum of $7.25 an hour at the beginning of January.
abstract: Minimum wage increases are set to take effect in 20 states, pushing number of states that exceed $7.25 federal minimum to 29; changes will affect some 60 percent of nation's work force, though difference will only be marginal in several states; battle to increase minimum wage has grown more intense amid rising income inequality, prompting Pres Obama to propose a new federal standard of $10.10 per hour.
lead_paragraph: Minimum wage increases go into effect in 20 states and the District of Columbia by Jan. 1, and, all told, 29 states will exceed the federal minimum of $7.25 an hour at the beginning of January.

headline.main: States’ Minimum Wages Rise, Helping Millions of Workers
headline.print_headline: Hourly Wage Is Going Up for Millions
